xxl.core.indexStructures
Class XTree

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree
      xxl.core.indexStructures.ORTree
          xxl.core.indexStructures.RTree
              xxl.core.indexStructures.XTree

public class XTree
extends RTree

The XTree is a variant of the RTree for high dimensional data which avoids splits which would result in high overlap. For a detailed discussion see Stefan Berchtold, Daniel A. Keim and Hans-Peter Kriegel: "The {X}-Tree: An Index Structure for High-Dimensional Data", VLDB (1996), 28-39.

See Also:
Tree, ORTree, RTree

Nested Class Summary
 class XTree.IndexEntry
          This class describes the index entries (i.e. the entries of the non-leaf nodes) of a x-tree.
 class XTree.IndexEntryConverter
          The instances of this class are converters to write index entries to the external storage (or any other DataOutput) or read them from it (or any other DataInput).
 class XTree.Node
          Node is the class used to represent leaf- and non-leaf nodes of XTree.
 class XTree.NodeConverter
          The instances of this class are converters to write nodes to the external storage (or any other DataOutput) or read them from it (or any other DataInput).

initialize

public XTree initialize(XTree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                        Descriptor rootDescriptor,
                        Function getDescriptor,
                        Container container,
                        int minCapacity,
                        int maxCapacity,
                        double maxOverlap,
                        double minFanout,
                        int numberOfDimensions)
Initializes a created XTree.

Parameters:
rootEntry - the new Tree.rootEntry
rootDescriptor - the new Tree.rootDescriptor
getDescriptor - the new Tree.getDescriptor
container - container used for as constant for Tree.getContainer and Tree.determineContainer
minCapacity - is used to define Tree.underflows, Tree.getSplitMinRatio and Tree.getSplitMaxRatio.
maxCapacity - is used to define Tree.underflows and Tree.overflows
maxOverlap - the new maxOverlap
minFanout - the new minFanout
numberOfDimensions - numberOfDimensions
Returns:
the initialized XTree

getNoOfDNode

public void getNoOfDNode(int[] noOfDNodePerLevel,
                         int[] bufferSize)
Counts the number of normal directory nodes per level in the X-tree.

Parameters:
noOfDNodePerLevel - array with a counter for each level
bufferSize - array containing the buffersize at index 0
